What is the purpose of the OPTION_NATIVECURRENCY option?

There is no OPTION_NATIVECURRENCY option. The available options include OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY, OPTION_GATEWAY, OPTION_PBAAS, OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER, OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER, and OPTION_NFT_TOKEN.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
How does the OPTION_PBAAS option restrict a chain to a single currency?

The OPTION_PBAAS option does not restrict a chain to a single currency. It is used to define a PBaaS chain. The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY option is used to potentially restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency, not the OPTION_PBAAS option.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What is the default converter for a PBaaS gateway when the OPTION_GATEWAY option is set?
The OPTION_GATEWAY option does not specify a default converter for a PBaaS gateway. The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER option is used to specify the default converter for a specific PBaaS gateway.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
